poem:
"On Supermarket Bakeries and Deceptions"

The steaming loaves, their tempting dob and glisten,
Taunting senses with deceptive aroma, a toasty kiss,
Four grand emporiums, beguiling, listeners listen.
Truth, dipped in dough, revealing a remiss.
Sliced bread's successor, a quivering question,
Packed with misleading claims, consumer transgression.
Through aisles and shelves, our trust shall wane,
In the real bread campaign, authenticity to regain.
